intro: Babiana pulchra, commonly known as the showy babiana, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range from red to yellow, are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Babiana pulchra is also cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
